page.title: 17Local Government
page.content: Our area lies within the old East Riding but as a result of the Redcliffe=Maud report it was designated to join Humberside, a new administrative area founded around the river Humber. Beneath this top layer of local government there is another band of local government - the District Council. Preston is governed from Skirlaugh.Interest in local government is at a fairly apathetic level and complaints that decisions are made with no reference to local opinion are not fair but probably reflect a much deeper disenchantment with government as a whole. Ironically the Preston Parish Council is well thought of and has made quite an impact on the locality.
